item.description:
YoYo Ma and the Silk Road Ensemble

 7:00 performance

 

If thunder/lightning threatens the concert, it will be moved to Woolsey Hall, 470 College Street New Haven.  Doors for Woolsey will open at 6:30.

From the Executive Director:

Dear Friends:

Tonight's performance by The Silk Road Ensemble with Yo-Yo Ma will take place outdoors on the Elm Street Stage, New Haven Green, as scheduled. We consulted with WTNH meteorologists, as well as meteorologists from two other television  stations in the state, and all agreed: scattered showers, but nothing that would prevent us from having a wonderful event. Our next stop was the musicians of the Silk Road Ensemble, who gave the thumbs up that the concert belongs on the New Haven Green and they are fully on board!

So pull out your rain boots, grab an umbrella, dress for cool weather and come on out! The best thing about Festival-goers is how incredibly intrepid they are! We anticipate an amazing evening and we hope to see you all there!

Festively yours,

Mary Lou Aleskie
Executive Director

Here is their web site : http://artidea.org/index.php

 also read below for new details about the lecture!!!!

 

Opening night of Arts & Ideas!    

Join us for a picnic and this amazing musical opportunity! Meet us at 5:30, Some have expressed an interest in bringing picnic food to share with the group, we have some talented chefs, and it is a fun twist! They do allow alcohol.  FREE DURATION 90 min LOCATION New Haven Green (Elm Street, Church Street, Chapel Street, and College Street, make up the perimeter of the Green).

<iframe width="560" height="349" src=" http://www.youtube.com/embed/Mlmzoj4kpDs" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Opening night kicks off with the Connecticut premiere of cellist Yo-Yo Ma's Silk Road Ensemble. The historic trade routes known as the Silk Road carried with them the exchange of art, ideas, and innovations between cultures for two thousand years. Investigating music as a means of interconnectivity and a vehicle for the migration of ideas, the Silk Road Ensemble's esteemed members are steeped in Eastern and Western traditions and contemporary musical crossroads.

"Classical musicmaking rarely achieves this combination of spontaneity and superb craftsmanship." The Washington Post

LECTURE:

If anyone is interested, there is a pre-show lecture with YoYo Ma at Sprague Hall at 3:00.  Doors open for the Yo-Yo Ma Talk at 2:30pm for Ideas Passholders and 2:45pm for the general public. We are expecting a large turnout for this event so if you want to ensure yourself a seat you should buy an Ideas Pass. Although this is a free event, all attendees will need a ticket. General Admission tickets will be available starting at 1:00pm on Saturday at the General Admission ticket table in the front of Sprague Hall. Limit one ticket per person.

DURATION 90 min LOCATION Sprague Memorial Hall, 470 College Street Yo-Yo Ma is the artistic director of the Silk Road Project, National Medal of Arts Recipient, and Grammy Award-winning cellist, who believes "Everything has a beginning somewhere, and leads to something else." Join Yo-Yo Ma for a lecture that connects the ancient trading route of the Silk Road to the idea that art and music are today's "Silk Road," providing cross-cultural exchanges that connect us globally and culturally.

Parking:

Street parking -metered and after 7:00 free.

Also there is a garage on Temple street between, Chapel and Crown Street,(both 1/2 block from the green). There is another Garage on College Street near the Shubert. More parking on York Street between Crown and Chapel, and Chapel Street between York and Park Streets.
item.how_to_find_us: I will fly the BW Scarf with piano keys on a pole, also will fly WHITE Balloons, 4 GROUPS OF 2 AROUND OUR COMPOUND assuming they all make it through the day!!!!
item.why: Arts & Ideas is always worth attending.
item.name: YoYo Ma and the Silk Road Ensemble
